programme.title: WW2 Treasure Hunters
programme.desc: Madness frontman Suggs and militaria expert Stephen Taylor unearth artefacts from former military sites across the UK, starting with a German bomber found in Liverpool.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff is late to the auction, leaving Ton Jones to bid for a bow-and-arrow set and a flame-thrower by himself.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: The competition is tough in Ton Jones's home town of Antelope Valley, California, where the guys manage to pick up two cheap units.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Mary shows a different side to her personality in Dallas and soon has a roaring crowd on its feet. Meanwhile, Ricky and Bubba are led astray by their latest find.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Fort Worth witnesses a showdown when Cowboy Matt begins throwing his weight around. Jenny's wins a locker containing a very strange item.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A selection of the best moments from the Pawn Stars' archive, including a Civil War veteran's rifle and a campaign ribbon from Lincoln's first election in 1860

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The greatest treasures and biggest disappointments in Pawn Star history, including a violin with million-dollar potential and a document signed by John Hancock.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: Liz faces a serious health crisis, Troy and the Texans settle their bet, and one of the teams makes a gamble that threatens the entire season.

programme.title: Ernie the Wildman
programme.desc: Following Ernie Brown Jr in Kentucky as he tries to relieve businesses and home-owners of unwanted and potentially deadly pests, including snakes, venomous spiders and possums.

programme.title: Ernie the Wildman
programme.desc: Following Ernie Brown Jr in Kentucky as he tries to relieve businesses and home-owners of unwanted and potentially deadly pests, including snakes, venomous spiders and possums.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The staff get the chance to buy a rare 1970s Indian mini-motorcycle.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Las Vegas pawnbrokers examine a classic 1967 Rokon Trailbreaker motorbike and a collection of rare Muhammad Ali memorabilia. They also have to decide whether a 1715 Escudo Spanish gold coin is a fake.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Topical comedy quiz show, hosted by Dara O Briain. Regular panellist Hugh Dennis looks back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of guests Tom Allen, Ed Byrne, Rhys James, Milton Jones and Deborah Frances-White. Stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Doc Brown, Richard Osman, Jon Richardson and regular participant Katherine Ryan are set tasks from pet rescue to pineapple concealment. Host Greg Davies and assitant Alex Horne ultimately decide who wins.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: David Mitchell is joined by MasterChef judge Gregg Wallace and actor Nigel Havers, while Lee Mack teams up with writer and comedian Charlie Brooker and actress Nina Wadia, as the comedy panel show hosted by Rob Brydon continues.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: David Mitchell is joined by comic actor Greg Davies and TV presenter Konnie Huq, while Lee Mack teams up with former cricketer Phil Tufnell and comedian Marcus Brigstocke, as the comedy panel show hosted by Rob Brydon continues.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: In the final episode of the series, Cat takes time off from being in love with himself to fall head over heels in love with a lady Cat with a big secret. Sci-fi comedy, starring Craig Charles, Danny John-Jules and Chris Barrie.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Lister and the crew discover a device that offers a new way of travelling through space, and find themselves transported to a giant theme park whose inhabitants - waxwork droids modelled to resemble famous figures from fiction and history - are fighting among themselves. Sci-fi comedy, starring Chris Barrie, Craig Charles and Danny John-Jules.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Tim Warwood and Adam Gendle attempt to come up with a next level surfboard to add to the Hawaiian's history book.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Hurting
programme.desc: Clip show featuring the voice of Jake Yapp, as home videos reveal the dumbest things attempted by adults, kids and even animals.

programme.title: The Hurting
programme.desc: Clip show featuring the voice of Jake Yapp, as home videos reveal the dumbest things attempted by adults, kids and even animals.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the offbeat event, where teams create vehicles without engines and race downhill. This round comes from St Patrick's Hill in Cork as competitors hope their vehicles have what it takes to clinch victory.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Compilation of two features on classic cars and SUVs. The presenters immerse themselves in the world of classic cars, with Jeremy Clarkson in a Fiat 124 Spider, Richard Hammond in an MGB GT and James May in a Peugeot 304 Cabriolet. They also enter the realm of the sports utility vehicle as they find out what sort of SUV can be bought for just a few hundred pounds before putting them through a series of challenges.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May compare the Mercedes SLS, the Porsche 911 GT3 RS and the Ferrari 458 Italia, as they race against each other in an epic road trip up America's east coast.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May are sent to Bolivia, where they are challenged to travel through the rainforest and journey to the coast of Chile, driving second-hand off-road vehicles bought locally for a maximum of Â£3,500 each. Along the way, they encounter drug lords and feel the effects of altitude sickness as they negotiate the region's roads, one of which is a notoriously dangerous 40-mile mountain pass dubbed El Camino de la Muerte - the Death Road.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Intrepid gravity-fuelled Soapbox Racers take on Observatory Hill overlooking Helsinki Harbour. How will they handle the brutal berm, the car wash and the ferocious kickers?.

programme.title: Hook (1991)
programme.desc: Peter Pan, who has finally grown up and is now a married lawyer with a family of his own, is whisked away by Tinkerbell to Neverland, where he must learn to fly again if he is to save his children from the clutches of Captain Hook. Steven Spielberg's fantasy adventure, with Robin Williams, Dustin Hoffman, Julia Roberts, Bob Hoskins and Maggie Smith.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the international event in London, as amateur drivers put their home-made, gravity-powered vehicles through an obstacle-littered course.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Toby organises a sponsored parachute jump to raise money for a children's ward in his hospital, so Lee, Lucy, Anna and the grandparents all agree to take part to support him. But once airborne, will everyone pluck up the courage to jump? Return of the comedy, starring Lee Mack, Sally Bretton and Hugh Dennis.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: The tensions of sharing a weekend cottage with friends are much in evidence as Lee and Lucy spend three nights in the New Forest with Toby and Anna. The beautiful countryside is forgotten as they squabble over who has the better bedroom, where they should go on their day trips, who should do the cooking and who should stay behind on the last day to tidy up the cottage. Comedy, starring Lee Mack, Sally Bretton, Hugh Dennis and Abigail Cruttenden.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee thinks the twins are too young to be taught about sex at school and that their teacher Miss Anstis is too stuck up to teach it. He resolves that it is his duty as a father to teach his children everything he knows about the facts of life, discovering only when it is too late that his knowledge is somewhat limited. Comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Topical comedy quiz show, hosted by Dara O Briain. Regular panellist Hugh Dennis looks back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of guests Ed Byrne, Ed Gamble, Kerry Godliman, Nish Kumar and Rachel Parris. Stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Topical comedy quiz show, hosted by Dara O Briain. Regular panellist Hugh Dennis looks back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of guests Angela Barnes, Ed Byrne, Larry Dean, Ed Gamble and Kerry Godliman. Stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Terms and Conditions Apply
programme.sub-title: A Really Low Budget Star Trek
programme.desc: Using his trademark, powerpoint-comedy and a series of mischievous games, Dave invites Jimmy Carr, Cariad Lloyd and Phill Jupitus to help him make sense of our insensible world.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A towering structure with an explosive past, a deserted cityscape, a mysterious top-secret facility and a vast Nazi construction.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look at the Shanghai Tower, which at a height of 632 metres is the second tallest building in the world, With a weight of 850,000 tons, it has been built to withstand winds of typhoon proportions.

programme.title: Samurai Warrior Queens
programme.desc: Dramatised documentary telling the story of Nakano Takeko, a female samurai who defied convention to lead a rebellion against Japan's western-influenced Emperor in 1868.

programme.title: History's Ultimate Spies
programme.desc: The story of Zofia Potocka, the lover of Russian military leader Grigory Potemkin, who ran a successful spy network in the Russo-Turkish War of 1787-92.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Graham Hill: Driven
programme.desc: An intimate portrait of motor racing star Graham Hill, who became the only man to win the Formula One World Championship, Indianapolis 500 and Le Mans 24-hour race - but whose reckless streak was to prove his undoing. Among those sharing their memories of the charismatic Englishman are his son Damon - who became Formula One world champion himself in 1996 - and Jackie Stewart.

programme.title: Jim Clark: The Quiet Champion
programme.desc: Profile of the two-time Formula One champion, who was killed at the height of his career. Featuring rare archive footage from family home-movies, candid interviews with the driver himself and comments by close friends, including Jackie Stewart, who reminisces about their time spent together racing when they were known as Batman and Robin.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The role played by engineering giant Vickers during the Second World War, including the development of the Spitfire and how the Royal Navy recovered from losing so many warships.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: How the Americans, once they were provoked into war, out-produced the rest of the world so quickly and by such a huge margin, including the likes of General Motors.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: The wildlife on the great plains of Africa, Asia, North America and the Arctic, which cover a quarter of the land on Earth. The distinctive Tibetan fox is captured on film for the first time, while a herd of caribou migrates 2,000 miles across the tundra in search of grass. Night vision equipment tracks a pride of 30 lions hunting elephants in the tropical African savannah near one of the region's few remaining waterholes. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: An insight into woodlands around the world, from the stunted conifers cloaked in snow and ice in the Arctic forests, to the broadleaf woods in North America and Europe. Also featured are the 100m-high giant redwoods of California, as well as Madagascar's unusual upside-down trees, which store water in their swollen trunks and harbour strange wildlife. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough observes some of the varied species to be found in tropical rainforests, from the amusing courtship rituals of the birds of paradise and a chimpanzee group defending its territory to a flying-frog mating orgy and the sinister parasitic fungi cordyceps, which eat their victims alive.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: Following the epic journey of a humpback whale and its calf as they travel from a tropical paradise to the species' great feeding ground in the icy polar seas. David Attenborough also observes footage of colonies of seabirds in the Arabian desert and surfing dolphins in Australia that swim onto the beach to catch their fish.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: An exploration of the survival techniques used by creatures inhabiting the deep oceans of the world, where adaptation is paramount for those dwelling on the surface as well as below. Pods of dolphins are filmed charging in search of prey, surprising methods for conserving energy are revealed as deep-sea octopuses 'fly' with wings, and vampire squid use bioluminescence to create a colourful display.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: The wildlife on the great plains of Africa, Asia, North America and the Arctic, which cover a quarter of the land on Earth. The distinctive Tibetan fox is captured on film for the first time, while a herd of caribou migrates 2,000 miles across the tundra in search of grass. Night vision equipment tracks a pride of 30 lions hunting elephants in the tropical African savannah near one of the region's few remaining waterholes. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: An insight into woodlands around the world, from the stunted conifers cloaked in snow and ice in the Arctic forests, to the broadleaf woods in North America and Europe. Also featured are the 100m-high giant redwoods of California, as well as Madagascar's unusual upside-down trees, which store water in their swollen trunks and harbour strange wildlife. Presented by David Attenborough.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: David Attenborough observes some of the varied species to be found in tropical rainforests, from the amusing courtship rituals of the birds of paradise and a chimpanzee group defending its territory to a flying-frog mating orgy and the sinister parasitic fungi cordyceps, which eat their victims alive.

programme.title: Planet Earth
programme.desc: Following the epic journey of a humpback whale and its calf as they travel from a tropical paradise to the species' great feeding ground in the icy polar seas. David Attenborough also observes footage of colonies of seabirds in the Arabian desert and surfing dolphins in Australia that swim onto the beach to catch their fish.

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: Status Quo play Pictures of Matchstick Men on Top of the Pops in 1968, the Who perform Long Live Rock in the Old Grey Whistle Test studio, Dire Straits deliver Tunnel of Love and Lynyrd Skynyrd bring a taste of the American South with Sweet Home Alabama. The programme also features rare performances from George Benson, Leo Kottke, Link Wray and Tom Petty.

programme.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive footage from BBC music shows of the 1970s. Including electric performances by the Rolling Stones, Eric Clapton, David Bowie, Motorhead, Nazareth, AC/DC and George Thorogood, as well as acoustic material by Michael Chapman, Horslips and Paco de Lucia.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Broadcaster Chris Tarrant continues his travels along the world's most challenging railways. Here he attempts to cross the Andes, setting off from the coast of Chile and heading for the Bolivian capital of Sucre. Along the way he traverses some of the driest and most inhospitable environments on the planet, hitches rides on unusual trains and deals with altitude sickness at more than 3,000 metres.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.sub-title: Chris Tarrant on the Polar Express
programme.desc: Chris sets out to reach the northernmost railway station on Earth, inside Russia's Arctic Circle. This is an epic 2,000-mile adventure from Moscow into Arctic Siberia, and begins with a marathon 19-hour leg. Along the way he enjoys a reindeer stew with a local family and takes the controls of one of the massive locomotives that power the trains, before pressing on along railways built under the brutal regime of Joseph Stalin.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Zak and Alex face a four-day mission to deliver a pair of classic steam locomotives for an Autumn Steam Gala at the Mid Hants Railway in Hampshire.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The clergyman is called in to investigate when two nuns die in unusual circumstances at St Agnes convent. However, the mystery attracts the attention of Sister Boniface, a would-be sleuth with a passion for detective novels. Crime drama remake, guest starring comedienne Lorna Watson.

programme.title: Lady Chatterley
programme.desc: First episode of Ken Russell's four-part adaptation of DH Lawrence's controversial novel. An aristocratic woman trapped in a sexless marriage embarks on a passionate affair with a gamekeeper. Joely Richardson and Sean Bean star.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part three of three. Adam tries to defuse the threat of strike action by the relief, reminding them of their duties as police officers and offering to let Yvonne return to the station while the inquiry takes its course. Dan reacts with dismay when Rochelle suggests they put their affair on hold, Gary chafes under Suzie's condescending attitude, and Samantha looks on in disbelief as the simmering hostility between brothers Phil and Steve erupts into violence.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Jessica Bailey finds it a struggle to fit in amongst the regiment, and an officer makes Chris McLeod jealous after he returns from leave.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Nigel has a dream date. Frank is out of his depth. Greg Hewitt has news for Arthur and Christine.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: Family secrets are revealed when Dr Finlay's mother comes to stay at Arden House. Dr Jennifer Napier, now using her own name, treats Annie Kirk who is suffering from a heart condition. Rural medical drama, starring David Rintoul, Ian Bannen and Annette Crosbie.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: Dr Napier becomes concerned at the generally poor state of women's health in Tannochbrae, and launches a bold new campaign to set matters right. Rhona falls head over heels in love, and two surprising would-be instructors step forward to teach the locals ballroom dancing. Highland medical drama, starring David Rintoul, Ian Bannen and Annette Crosbie.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Part two of two. The roguish antiques dealer finds a Scottish gothic temple brings him closer to Lady Jane, while love is in the air for Eric. Ian McShane stars.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: Lady Felicia is horrified to find an injured man stuck in a tree on her estate, apparently thrown there from a passing train on an overhead viaduct. When Sid is implicated as the guilty party, Father Brown is left to clear his name - but only if he is truly innocent. Mystery drama, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The Church of Apollo comes to Kembleford and Susie is immediately drawn to Kalon, its charismatic leader. After his wife is murdered, Father Brown must break his spell over Susie or risk losing her for ever. Drama, starring Kasia Koleczek, Michael Maloney and Mark Williams.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The clergyman is called in to investigate when two nuns die in unusual circumstances at St Agnes convent. However, the mystery attracts the attention of Sister Boniface, a would-be sleuth with a passion for detective novels. Crime drama remake, guest starring comedienne Lorna Watson.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest joins in the search for a girl who is believed to be radioactive, and tries to find out who is responsible for her overnight disappearance. Drama, starring Kasia Koleczek and Mark Williams.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest investigates a murder at the Kembleford charity treasure hunt. General suspicion falls on a bereaved man who wants revenge, but Father Brown is determined to prove he is innocent. Mystery, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The mayor is electrocuted while speaking at the Kembleford village fete, and Father Brown suspects he was the victim of a deliberate act. Meanwhile, Mrs McCarthy's past comes back to haunt her. Mystery, starring Mark Williams and Sorcha Cusack.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest's priceless Blue Cross is targeted by infamous criminal Flambeau, so taking matters into his own hands Father Brown sets out to try to save the thief's soul, but risks falling into a trap. Mystery, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Crime drama about a British detective working on a Caribbean island. When the owner of a sugar plantation is discovered dead with a machete in his back, DI Poole and his team have a seemingly impossible case to solve. There are numerous suspects, including the victim's alcoholic ex-wife and much younger widow, but they all have seemingly cast-iron alibis - and many were with one another when the murder took place. Crime drama, starring Ben Miller, with guest appearances by Stephanie Beacham (Dynasty, Tenko), James Cosmo (Game of Thrones) and Tom Ward (Silent Witness).

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: A young nun is found dead in a smoke-filled bedroom in what seems like a terrible accident caused by a lit cigarette. But when Richard deduces it must have been murder, there are no shortage of suspects, including other nuns, a priest and the mother superior - as well as an unscrupulous PR man promoting a holy spring in the convent grounds. The question is, with the room locked from the inside, how could anyone have committed the crime in the first place? Kenneth Cranham, Patrick Baladi and Caroline Langrishe guest star.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: Murdoch reunites with inventor Nikola Tesla to help with the murder investigation of a man experimenting on a devise that would make him invisible.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: A body is discovered floating in the pool of an exclusive cosmetic surgery clinic and several things point to suicide - the victim was going through a messy divorce and there is an empty pill box in her room. But DI Poole has several reasons to believe Valerie Dupree was murdered - not least the fact she poured herself a cup of the world's most expensive tea but only drank half. The pressure is on to find the culprit as the clinic is highly respected on the island and the chief surgeon is an old friend of Commissioner Patterson - and as the detectives begin to dig, they discover many sordid secrets among the guests and staff. Cherie Lunghi (Secret Diary of a Call Girl), James Fleet (The Vicar of Dibley) and Emma Pierson (Hotel Babylon) guest star.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Treasure hunters arrive on the island to track down the loot of a legendary pirate, a search that comes to an abrupt halt when the party's geologist is shot dead in leader Daniel Morgan's tent. As the murder weapon was a 300-year-old pistol, DI Poole decides every member of the team is a suspect - but the investigation takes a strange turn when Daniel falls victim to a series of unfortunate and coincidental accidents. Has a mythical pirate's curse become a reality or is someone from the 21st century simply trying to bump him off? Ben Miller and Sara Martins star, with Michael Brandon (Dempsey and Makepeace) and Kelly Adams (Hustle).

programme.title: Lady Chatterley
programme.desc: Sir Clifford employs a nurse to look after him, leaving his wife with more time to devote to her clandestine relationship with Mellors. However, the passion of the affair is beginning to wane. Starring Joely Richardson and Sean Bean.

programme.title: The Theory of Everything (2014)
programme.desc: Biopic of Stephen Hawking, exploring the renowned astrophysicist's romance with future wife Jane during their time at university in the 1960s and his initial diagnosis with motor neurone disease, which doctors believed would lead to his death within two years. Undaunted by deteriorating health, he continued his groundbreaking research into the origins of the universe. Starring an Oscar-winning Eddie Redmayne, with Felicity Jones and David Thewlis.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Who's Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: TV presenter Charlotte Hawkins puts on a dinner party for four strangers, who have to work out the identity of their mystery celebrity host with the help of a few cryptic clues - otherwise they will be doing the washing up. Hosted by Brian McFadden.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Twinkle says goodbye to her friends to rejoin her people. But when the team - now the Super 3 - have to stave off a Sykronian invasion, they cannot do it without Twinkle.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Rock Brock becomes the target of an angry elf after he breaks his magic cauldron during a battle with a ferocious dragon - or so he says.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Fast flowing waters await Danny in today's dare as he takes on a white-water rafting course including the UK's steepest man-made drop..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz and Weasel are trying to steal the president's jokebook. Magoo, thinking he is visiting a museum of sorcery, mistakes Weasel for a wizard..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz has invented a hoverboard. After a slip-up, the board ends up in the hands of Magoo, who thinks he has found a new ironing board..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz falls into the sewers, only to bump into Magoo, who thinks he's exploring the jungle. The latter mistakes Fizz for a lost child..

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean disguises himself as a Pensioner in order to avoid lunch with Irma and her mum..

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean climbs into his favourite tree to stop it from being chopped down..

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: Team Tennyson checks out a Samurai Museum in Tokyo.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: George takes the Spuds to the museum of mouldy cheese. Anna dares Dave to lick the cheeses on display, and Dave's bad breath wakes one of the exhibits up.

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Gran accidentally wins a board game as a Bingo prize, and after being locked up for years the game has a vendetta all of its own..

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James presents a special Easter edition of the cookery show, joined by Matthew Kelly and chefs Nathan Outlaw and Paul Foster. Also dropping in is Bake Off: Creme De La Creme winner Mark Tilling, who demonstrates how to make some chocolate treats.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James goes on a culinary journey around the UK, with fellow chef and friend Galton Blackiston joining him as he begins in the Isles of Scilly. The pair don diving suits to swim with seals and hire an unusual mode of transport to take them around the islands.

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott hops across to the Italian island of Sardinia, where his first stop is the beachside Ristorante La Spigola for a taste of chef Roberto's modern take on Italian dining. He also gets immersed in a classic Sardinian culinary experience, cooking suckling pig over an open fire, has a masterclass in making the local pasta Jiusoni and learns about another island speciality, casizolu cheese.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Joyce Barnaby swerves off the road into a ditch, convinced she has hit someone, but nobody is found injured and Tom thinks she has imagined it. However, when a local historian discovers the body of a librarian in a nearby cemetery, Joyce blames herself for the man's death, leading her husband into a spooky investigation to find the real killer on the loose in the haunted village of March Magna. Guest starring Danny Webb (The Bill), with John Nettles, Jason Hughes and Jane Wymark.

programme.title: Tipping Point: Lucky Stars
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts another celebrity edition of the game show, which see three of the stars from hit comedy Benidorm - Jake Caruso, Janine Duvitski and Tony Maudsley - answering questions and lining up the drop zones as they try to win as much cash as they can for their chosen charities.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Colin Baker, David Weir, Chelsee Healey and Alex Horne pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Ninja Warrior UK
programme.desc: Competitors from across the nation test their strength, speed and courage in this obstacle-course challenge, hosted by Ben Shephard, Rochelle Humes and Chris Kamara. Members of the public compete alongside celebrities including Jake Quickenden, Dom Lever, Katie Walsh and Lee Latchford-Evans. Those who make it to the end of the adrenaline-fuelled mission face one final task - scaling the heights of a tower named Mount Midoriyama - as they battle it out for the title of Ninja Warrior UK.

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show from locations around the UK, setting members of the public unusual challenges for a chance to win anything from the price of their petrol, to Â£1000 in the big finale game. This week, Stephen is in Bognor Regis.

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the 14th series of the nationwide talent search, which sees a wide variety of acts, from comedians to contortionists, singers to spoon players, compete for the chance to win a huge cash prize and a coveted slot at the Royal Variety Performance. Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and David Walliams make up the judging panel, looking for performers worthy of the Golden Buzzer and a slot in the semi-finals.

programme.title: Through the Keyhole
programme.desc: Keith Lemon hosts the third series of the revival of the classic game show originally presented by David Frost. Visiting three mystery celebrity homes each week, he challenges an all-star panel to guess the identities of the famous occupants based on clues highlighted along each tour and the help of the studio audience. In this edition, the Celebrity Juice funnyman is joined by celebrity chef Gino D'Acampo, Coronation Street star Sue Cleaver (Eileen Grimshaw), and comedian and actor Johnny Vegas.

programme.title: The River Wild (1994)
programme.desc: A headstrong white-water rafting expert embarks on a holiday with her family, but their fun comes to an abrupt end when two killers show up. The fugitives' only escape route from the law is down a raging river, so they take the woman and her son hostage to act as guides. Meanwhile, her husband desperately tries to keep track from the riverbank, waiting for his opportunity to launch a rescue attempt. Action thriller, starring Meryl Streep, Kevin Bacon, David Strathairn, Joseph Mazzello and John C Reilly.

programme.title: The Saturday Hotmix!
programme.desc: An exclusive, non-stop mix of the hottest songs to soundtrack your Saturday evening!.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: Preventing planes from icing up in extremely cold conditions, the use of clay to make magazine pages glossy, and constructing a 125mph electric car.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mechanic Edd China teams up with Mike Brewer to get a classic Saab 900 Turbo back on the road.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China face the challenge of working to a tight budget as they continue with the Saab 900 Turbo restoration.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard calls on some legendary hoarders such as Chris, who collects cement mixers and has an herbaceous car park. His hope is that he will be able to persuade someone to sell their stuff.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: The team builds a complex hybrid chopper for an electrics company, and the rift within the Teutul family continues when Paul Sr angrily returns a motorcycle to his son.

programme.title: Airplane Repo
programme.desc: While Mike Kennedy attempts his first helicopter heist, Danny puts his partnership with Ken in jeopardy when he steps out on his own to repossess a Cessna 340

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: The intrepid Mike Rowe takes on a succession of less than pleasant tasks, each involving a certain amount of grime and discomfort.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.sub-title: Zip Line Brakes/Silk Fibre Lamps/Round Balers/Comfort Shoes
programme.desc: The creation, development and manufacture of zip line brakes, silk fibre lamps, round balers and comfort shoes.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: An insight into the manufacturing processes behind the creation of armoured vehicles, tension fabric buildings and rowers, reflecting on how processes have changed over the years.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Auto enthusiast Mike Brewer finds an affordable Morgan to restore, but it provides mechanic Edd China with one of the biggest jobs he has ever faced.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: To celebrate their 100th car, Mike Brewer and Edd China restore a Darracq Type L. However, it remains to be seen whether they will be ready in time to face the famous London to Brighton run.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Sales supremo Mike Brewer has always wanted to have an old Caterham in the workshop, but mechanic Edd China decides to take a risk by painting it a shocking colour.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer tries to track down the first-ever Bond car, a 1963 Sunbeam Alpine. He finds a rust-free, race-ready motor, but Edd China discovers some surprises in the engine bay.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds a 1966 Morris Minor Traveller for the bargain price of Â£2,400, and makes plans for Edd China to renovate it so he sell it on for at least Â£7,000

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer unearths a quintessential piece of British motoring history with a Rover P5B, and the car appears to be in good condition, but Edd China's upgrades won't be cheap.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer goes in search of a Lotus Elan for sale, before handing the keys of the British sports car to Edd China so he can give the vehicle a new lease of life.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: On the Road
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer has a budget of Â£5,000 to buy a Lotus Esprit and finds one without an MOT. Edd China's work begins with removing the interior and the engine.

programme.title: Walking the Amazon
programme.desc: In the first of a two-part documentary, former soldier Ed Stafford embarks on a quest to become the first person to walk the entire length of the South American river. He begins his 4,500-mile journey in Peru with friend Luke Collier and native guide Oswaldo, but three months in, he faces the prospect of travelling through a dangerous drug-trafficking area alone when they both threaten to leave the expedition.

programme.title: Walking the Amazon
programme.desc: In the concluding part of the documentary, former soldier Ed Stafford and his Peruvian pal Cho have reached Tabatinga, near where the borders of Peru, Brazil and Colombia meet. As they head due east toward Manaus, the state capital of Amazonas, they battle bugs, caimans, dehydration and mental fatigue - and a wrong turn proves costly while trying to make it to the river mouth.

programme.title: World's Deepest Goldmine
programme.desc: South Africa's Mponeng mine reaches 3,500km into the ground, but its gold reserves are almost exhausted. This documentary questions whether the risks posed to the underground workers justify burying even deeper into the Earth.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Tunnel Rats are under extra pressure as rival miners close in on their claim. Plus, the Bushmen must brave an abandoned mine to remove a dead animal.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Ant Anstead bring a sought-after 1965 Austin-Healey 3000 MKIII to auction, and hope their sparking new interior will be enough to secure a huge pay-cheque.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Salvage aficionado, Drew Pritchard teams up with Paul Cowland for a motoring mission, scouring the UK, buying, restoring and selling classic cars.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard decides that he needs something different to stand out from the competition. He and Tee head to Italy hoping to find some antiques that his rivals won't be able to match.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team restore a broken hand mirror containing the portrait of a mysterious French lady, and a painting of fog on the river Thames is also repaired.

programme.title: Robson Green's Australian Adventure
programme.desc: The actor explores some of the most remote locations in Australia's biggest state, hoping to gain an understanding of how people live and work isolated from the rest of the country.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Tunnel Rats are under extra pressure as rival miners close in on their claim. Plus, the Bushmen must brave an abandoned mine to remove a dead animal.

programme.title: The Lady Killers
programme.desc: Kelly and Jason Cochran formed a killer husband-and-wife team. However, she afterwards turned on him. It is believed she may have killed another nine men. Cochran is also suspected of serving the dismembered remains of one victim at a barbecue for neighbours.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Fragments of bone recovered from a swamp help to identify the victim of a serial killer and bring the culprit to court, while forensic anthropologist Doug Owsley examines the skull of a female who died as a result of stabbing.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.sub-title: The Man in the Red Jacket
programme.desc: On Valentine's night 2015, 27-year-old James Enright was stabbed to death near a station in Burnaby, Canada. Police were heped in their inquiries after discovering the incident had been captured on a phone camera.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The murders of retired Michigan police officer Michael Greene and his wife Terri in their home. Police found evidence of a personal grudge as a possible motive for the crime.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The case of a boy and his mother who were kidnapped by a vicious drug cartel, and how the FBI prosecuted all the members of the gang through the use of surveillance.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Investigator Jennifer Francis finds a neglected pair of horses and a donkey, prompting the SPCA to battle for custody of the animals in court.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Sydney veterinary surgeon Dr Chris Brown treats a baby cheetah, a shaking cavoodle and a pig.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: American Chopper star Paul Teutul Jr accompanies his fiancee Rachael to Kleinfeld's as they look for the right dress for their red carpet wedding.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Kelly looks for a red dress for her wedding, while Beth decides to avoid traditional white gowns in favour of something black.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Indian bride Rashi wants an American-style gown, while Shenelle returns for her fitting, nervous about seeing her custom dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Krystle is getting married to baseball player Ryan Howard and wants to find the perfect dress, while Southern belle Deshae looks for something with glitz, beads and sparkle.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Katie is looking for a dress to celebrate her new beginning following a lung transplant, while Christy comes in for her first fitting after losing more than 11 stone.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Even after gaining confidence from losing weight, Victoria still seeks her mother's approval on her dress, while Lauren and her mum disagree on styles of gowns.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Trisha's father helps her pick out a dress, while Caitlin has her fitting now that her dad is well enough to attend.

programme.title: Bondi Vet: Coast to Coast
programme.desc: Dr Kate anxiously awaits her dog's test results. Dr Danni volunteers at a pop-up clinic, while Dr Alex has a house call check-up with a pig and her piglets.

programme.title: Bondi Vet: Coast to Coast
programme.desc: Dr Lewis tries to solve a mysterious condition on a dog. Plus, at Perth Zoo Dr Peter looks after an elephant and Dr Danni helps a dog with a suspected twisted stomach.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The Bureau's quest to identify members of terrorist group Omega 7, whose crimes include bombings and assassinations including that of Cuban refugee leader Eulalio Jose Negrin.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The hunt for the FALN terrorist group, who were suspected of setting off several bombs across America during the 1970s and 1980s.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: When a man is brutally attacked by three armed assailants, bureau investigators are convinced it is the work of the Mafia - even though they are unable to identify the perpetrators.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Before his arrest in 1994, the bank robber known as the Shootist performed more than 50 robberies across the states of California, Texas and Washington. This programme details how FBI agents were able to bring him to justice.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Mother-of-five Cynthia weighs 610 pounds and is physically unable to carry on her job as a special needs teacher. She resolves to lose weight for the sake of her career and her family.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Self-described 'secret eater' Doug is managing to hide his snacking. However, his obesity is stopping him from living a full life with his wife, who is now demanding a change.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Forty four-year-old Erica binges on food when faced with adversity, and previous weight-loss surgery was unsuccessful. Can she get the support she needs to change her habits?.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa Caputo is an average mum from Long Island - except that she talks to the dead. With a waiting list of over two years, she has turned sceptics into believers.

programme.title: Hoarding: Buried Alive
programme.desc: One mother's battle with hoarding is overshadowed by the discovery of her own daughter's compulsion to also hold on to things. Can they be helped?.

programme.title: Dr G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: The doctor tries to piece together the causes of two mystery deaths. Firstly, she is under pressure when a four-month-old boy dies - can she find out what killed him in time to safeguard his twin brother? Plus, the unexpected death of a young father needs to be investigated.

programme.title: Copycat Killers
programme.desc: The case of Christian Gerhartsreiter, who posed as a high society figure in a chilling echo of The Talented Mr Ripley - murdering to protect his true identity.

programme.title: Dead of Winter
programme.desc: The murders of an elderly North Dakota couple during an attack in their home. Detectives discovered a crime scene hopelessly compromised.
